channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: What will Trump-Zelenskyy meeting entail? Former national security adviser explains
item.description: Former national security adviser Jake Sullivan says President Trump will "put all the pressure on Zelenskyy" to make a peace deal with Russia, during their meeting in Washington, D.C. today.

item.title: Trump says Putin and Zelenskyy will meet for talks on ending the war
item.description: Trump made the announcement after a day of talks with Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy and a delegation of top European officials. He said he'd meet with the two leaders afterward, but did not say when.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Ukraine's Zelenskyy and European leaders to meet Trump at White House Monday, Israelis protest to demand a hostage deal as leaders plan to occupy Gaza City, more National Guard troops heading to D.C.

item.title: Journalist and author Jon Lee Anderson discusses his book 'To Lose a War'
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with journalist and author Jon Lee Anderson about his new book, "To Lose a War." The book collects Anderson's writing from Afghanistan over a near-quarter-century span.

item.title: Israeli protesters demand end to war in Gaza and deal to release remaining hostages
item.description: Israelis held one of their biggest protests in nearly two years, demanding an end to the war in Gaza and a deal to release the remaining hostages. But Israeli leaders plan a military escalation.

item.title: Aid groups say Israel's use of air dropping food into Gaza is deadly and inefficient
item.description: Aid groups say Israel's policy of air dropping food into Gaza is inefficient and that hundreds of trucks should do the job. They also say the use of air drops is deadly.

item.title: Younger adults getting 'baby Botox' to stop wrinkles from forming
item.description: A growing number of 20-somethings are trying to stop wrinkles from forming on their face with a preventative treatment known as "baby Botox," which freezes facial muscles to limit movement.

item.title: NCAA fines University of Michigan football millions in sign-stealing scandal
item.description: The NCAA fined University of Michigan football millions of dollars for a scheme to figure out the signs other teams use in games. NPR speaks with Larry Lage, sports reporter for the Associated Press.

item.title: Alaska's fiscal crisis hurting its public school system
item.description: With oil prices and production down, Alaska's fiscal crisis has impacted its public school system, and there's not enough money in state coffers to fix crumbling buildings.

item.title: Zelenskyy and European leaders to meet with Trump at White House on Monday
item.description: European leaders will travel with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy for a meeting with President Trump at the White House with on Monday.
